title: Enhancing Collaborative Learning Capabilities via Interaction Analysis in Online Learning Communities

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge and mobile device usage proficiency
context.additional_context: Analyzing interaction patterns and facilitating collaborative learning among large-scale learners in smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain three interaction types—content creation, consumption, and organization—in online community discussions
Learners can visualize and interpret collaborative learning patterns by utilizing network analysis metrics (distance, reciprocity, influence).
Learners can propose at least three strategies to facilitate effective interaction with peer learners when solving math problems in a mobile environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
